Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk gnome-boxes
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: gnome-boxes bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The gnome-boxes packages contain a simple GNOME 3 application to access remote or virtual systems. The gnome-boxes and libosinfo packages have been upgraded to upstream versions 3.14.2 and 0.2.11 respectively, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous versions. For more information, see the GNOME release notes in the References section and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2 Release Notes. (BZ#1174555, BZ#1174552) This update also fixes the following bugs: When using the Boxes application with device nodes as main disks, importing libvirt virtual machines (VMs) from the system broker failed and caused boxes to terminate unexpectedly. This bug has been fixed, and VMs are now imported using Boxes successfully in the described scenario. (BZ#1201255) Due to a bug in Anaconda code, the libosinfo packages did not recognize Fedora 21 Server and Fedora 22 Workstation, which thus could not be set as a distribution while installing a VM. This bug has been fixed, and both Fedora 21 Server and Fedora 22 Workstation can be installed, can boot, and the user can be created properly. (BZ#1211178) On the guestfish shell, the os-inspect command previously failed to show Windows 8.1 32- and 64-bit ISO files available for installation on the operating systems. A patch has been applied to fix this bug, and os-inspect returns a list of available operating systems as expected. (BZ#1129963) Users of gnome-boxes are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
